content: The limit is reached for the number of rooms: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message indicating when the room quota limit has been reached, showing the current value and maximum allowed value. It appears in a quotas bar component, specifically on the Rooms Tariff Limit section.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'The limit is reached' is better translated as '최대 허용량에 도달했습니다' or '최대 개수에 도달했습니다' rather than '한도에 도달했습니다'. '한도' is often used for financial limits, while '최대 허용량' or '최대 개수' is more appropriate for a room quota.

The Lao translation "ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງເຕັມແລ້ວ: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}" literally translates to "Number of rooms is full: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}". While understandable, a more natural phrasing would emphasize the limit being reached.  A better translation would convey the sense of 'Quota reached' or 'Limit reached'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເຕືອນ ຈຳນວນຫ້ອງເຕັມຕາມກຳນົດ: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon after 'ierobežojums' should have a space after it.
The translation 'Limita maximă permisă de săli a fost atinsă' is a bit verbose and less natural than a simpler phrasing. While technically correct, it could be improved for better user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Limita a fost atinsă pentru numărul de camere: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'කෙටිහන් ගණන සඳහා සීමාව ඉක්මවා ඇත' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'The limit is reached for the number of rooms'.  'කෙටිහන්' (ketihăn) translates to 'shorts' or 'briefs', not 'rooms'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more accurate translation would be something like 'මාබිමේ ගණන සඳහා සීමාව ඉක්මවා ඇත' (mābimē ganaṇā samā darā sēmiwā ikmavā atā) - 'The limit is reached for the number of rooms'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation 'Limit počtu miestností je dosiahnutý' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'The limit is reached...'. A more appropriate translation would be 'Dosiahnutý je limit počtu miestností' or 'Bol dosiahnutý limit počtu miestností'.
The English phrase "The limit is reached" is better translated as something more active or indicative of the limit being hit. "Dosežena je omejitev" is a bit passive.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Preko dovoljene meje za število sob: {{currentValue}} / {{maxValue}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, 'Достигнут је лимит за број просторија' is a bit literal and less natural-sounding. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Прекоречен је лимит за број просторија' or 'Достигнут је максимални број просторија'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Прекоречен је лимит за број просторија
